intro: Hieracium gronovii var. normale, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems and a basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands.
